timeline.summary: On July 14, 2020, an email was sent detailing Ghislaine Maxwell’s legal calls to Christian Everdell between July 6th and July 14th, 2020. The calls ranged from 30 minutes to 1.5 hours, with several involving Mark Cohen, Laura Menninger, Jeff Pagliuca, and Lea Harmon (Pretrial services). The email was sent to advise against potential misrepresentation by Mark Cohen during a hearing.

Jeff Pagliuca of Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C. sent a letter to multiple counsel (Laura Menninger, Christian Everdell, Mark S. Cohen, Nicole Simmons) regarding a protective order, specifically "letter_to_USA_re_protective_orderJ002)_(002)final.pdf." The letter included an attached PDF and an image. The email contains a standard warning about confidential and privileged information.

An email chain discusses a protective order related to materials in a grand jury investigation involving Maxwell’s civil cases. One party (identified as “[REDACTED]”) proposes disclosing victim names based on case law, suggesting a response mirroring a letter to Netburn. Another party, Jeff Pagliuca, attached a conferral letter and advocates for allowing the materials to remain under seal, noting the potential for resolving the issue if certain parties were informed. The emails involve multiple legal professionals including Christian Everdell and Mark S. Cohen.

Jeff Pagliuca (Haddon, Morgan & Foreman, P.C.) sent a letter to multiple attorneys regarding a discovery request to the Southern District of New York. The Government’s Assistant U.S. Attorney responded on August 11th, stating they would provide a response by August 13th.  Jeff Pagliuca requested a phone call to discuss the matter, citing a need for expedited communication due to a tight schedule and a late discovery revelation. Nicole Simmons and other counsel confirmed receipt of the materials and indicated they would respond promptly, noting technical difficulties with their email system.

An email chain discusses a draft response to a letter from Jeff Pagliuca regarding unsealed discovery materials. The email exchange involves individuals at Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C. and Cohen Gresser LLP. A draft letter is attached, and the sender, [REDACTED], expresses willingness to discuss edits. The recipient, (USANYS), was expected to review the materials upon their return the following day.  A standard disclaimer regarding confidential information is also included.

The email discusses proposed redactions to defense letters related to the case *US v. Maxwell*, case number 20 Cr. 330 (MN), as ordered by the court on September 2, 2020. The attached documents contain the agreed-upon redactions to two defense letters submitted on August 24, 2020. The email is from the Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York and involves parties including Jeff Pagliuca, Christian Everdell, Nathan NYSD Chambers, and S. Cohen.

The email, dated September 4, 2020, from the Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York to Christian Everdel, Mark S. Cohen, Laura Menninger, and Jeff Pagliuca, proposes redactions to defense letters dated August 24, 2020, related to case number 20 Cr. 330 (AJN). The proposed redactions are submitted per Judge Nathan's order and attached as PDFs. The sender requests confirmation of acceptance.

An email chain discusses a letter from Christian Everdell to the Assistant United States Attorneys regarding requests for information. The Assistant United States Attorneys state they are reviewing the requests and intend to provide a written response, noting some requests, including one previously denied by a judge, will likely delay a response before October 21, 2020. The initial letter from Christian Everdell attached requests information related to a case.

On October 26, 2020, Christian Everdell requested unredacted copies of reports and notes related to “United States v. Maxwell” from Mark S. Cohen, Laura Menninger, Jeff Pagliuca, and Bobbi Sternheim. The attachments included redacted documents from the United States Attorney's Office, Southern District of New York, concerning the case. The request was made in response to previous redactions and a protective order.

Maxwell* was submitted. *   The initial deadline was November 9, 2020. *   The outside vendor, PAE, responsible for processing the discovery materials (extracted electronic devices from Jeffrey Epstein’s residences), informed the US Attorney’s office that they would not meet the deadline due to technical difficulties with bates stamping and downloading the production. *   PAE anticipates completing the work by November 19, 2020, and will then send the materials to 1 St. Andrew’s Plaza for review. *   The US Attorney’s office intends to request a two-week extension of the deadline, ending on November 23, 2020, specifically for the vendor-processed materials. *   Jeff Pagliuca initially requested more information before taking a position and the case team had been struggling with client calls and visitation.

On December 16, 2020, the Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York submitted documents in opposition to a defendant’s renewed bail application in the case of *US v. Maxwell, 20 CR. 330 (AJN)*. The submission included a cover letter, memorandum of law, Government Exhibits A and B, and a proposed redaction document for the memorandum of law. The documents were sent to Nathan NYSD Chambers and several attorneys including Christian Everdell, BOBBI C STERNHEIM, and Jeff Pagliuca.

This email chain, dated December 30, 2020, discusses redactions related to document EFTA00030052. It involves recipients including Mark S. Cohen, Bobbi Stemheim, Jeff Pagliuca, and Laura Menninger. An attached message, “Redactions.msg,” likely contains details of the redactions performed.

Christian Everdell of Cohen & Gresser LLP sent an email to Bobbi C. Sternheim, Jeff Pagliuca, Laura Menninger, and Mark S. Cohen regarding a request for a Bill of Particulars. The email included an attachment: “2021-01-10 Leuer_Response_to_GM_Request_for_Bill_of Particularsfinal).pdf.” A confidentiality notice and privacy policy link were also included.

Christian Everdell of Cohen Gresser responds to discovery requests regarding EFTA00020977, involving recipients including Mark Cohen, Bobbi Stemheim, Jeff Pagliuca, Laura Henninger, and USAHUB-USAJournal. The correspondence originated on February 1, 2021.

Bobbi Sternheim sent an email to [REDACTED], Christian, and Jeff Pagliuca regarding the U.S. v. Maxwell case (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)). The email attached a courtesy copy of an ECF filing, specifically a letter concerning MDC conditions (“MDC Conditions_Letter_2-16_FINAL.pdf”) and a related HTML document (“ATT00001.htm”).

An email was sent from Bobbi C. Sternheim to multiple recipients, including IMSYS and Christian Everdell, on February 23, 2021. The email attached a courtesy copy of an Electronic Correspondence Filing (ECF) related to the U.S. v. Maxwell case (20 Cr. 330). The email contained a disclaimer regarding confidential and privileged information. The document referenced is MAXWELL_BAIL_APPLICATION_with_EXHIBIT_2-23-17.pdf.

Bobbi C. Sternheim sent a courtesy copy of an ECF filing (MAXWELL_BAIL_APPLICATION_with_EXHIBIT_2-23-17.pdf) related to the case *U.S. v. Maxwell* (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)) to several recipients, including Christian Everdell, Laura Mennin, and Jeff Pagliuca. The email contains a confidentiality and privilege disclaimer.

Email correspondence regarding the case *U.S. v. Maxwell 20 Cr. 330 (AJN)*.  Multiple individuals, including Bobbi C. Sternheim, Laura Menninger, Jeff Pagliuca, and Christian Everdell, exchanged emails related to an Electronic Case File (ECF) filing concerning a bail application for Maxwell. The email chain indicates a previous unsuccessful attempt (“third time’s the charm”) related to the case.

An email chain discusses a bail application for Maxwell in U.S. v. Maxwell 20 Cr. 330 (AJN). Bobbi Sternheim sent a copy of the application to [REDACTED] and requested a discussion regarding Maxwell’s proposed financial conditions before drafting a response. The email chain includes acknowledgements of the application’s unusual nature and a disclaimer regarding confidential information contained within the attached documents.

Laura Mcnninger, of Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C., sent an email to multiple recipients including Jeff Pagliuca, Christian Everdell, and BC Sternheim, requesting to view evidence in the case of *US v. Maxwell* (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)). The email attached a letter detailing the request and included a confidentiality notice emphasizing the sensitive nature of the materials.

Bobbi Sternheim sent an unredacted version of the Reply Memorandum In Support of Ms. Maxwell’s pending bail application to Nathan Chambers, Christian Everdell, Laura Menninger, and Jeff Pagliuca in connection with the U.S. v. Ghislaine Maxwell case (20 Cr. 330 (MN)). The submission was provided pursuant to Rule 2(8) of the court’s individual rules.

This document is a series of email exchanges between the Southern District of New York’s Assistant United States Attorney (Chris Everdell) and various parties, including Laura Menninger and Jeff Pagliuca, regarding discovery materials related to a case, likely involving Jared Epstein. Here’s a breakdown of the key points: *   **Discovery Issues:** The primary concern is a series of technical issues with the delivered discovery materials, including missing attachments, incorrect metadata, and gaps in production numbers. *   **Metadata Problems:** Specifically, many electronic documents and photographs lack CART numbers and have dates after the purported seizure dates, causing difficulty in accessing and interpreting the data. Requests are made for metadata overlays. *   **Hard Drive Delivery:** The Assistant US Attorney is requesting the delivery of a hard drive containing the discovery materials to Ms. Maxwell, but the other party is hesitant and proposes alternative solutions. *   **Missing Production Numbers:** A gap exists between production numbers 11/18 and 12/18, and the Assistant US Attorney is inquiring about its intentionality. *   **Coordination & Support:** The Assistant US Attorney is requesting a call to discuss these issues and offers to assist with providing materials to Ms. Maxwell. *   **Redactions:** The document contains redactions, indicating the presence of sensitive or confidential information.

Maxwell* (20 Cr. 330 (MN)). It details a collaborative effort between the Assistant United States Attorney’s Office (Southern District of New York), Laura Menninger and her legal team (Haddon, Morgan & Foreman, P.C.), Jeff Pagliuca, Christian Everdell, and Bobby Sternheim. Key elements include: *   **Scheduled Reviews:** The Marshals intend to bring Maxwell to 500 Pearl Street daily, beginning April 13th, for evidence review. *   **Revised Spreadsheets:** The AUSA has provided updated spreadsheets (with annotations) of evidence, designating Protective Orders and noting item locations. Three VHS tapes are central to this designation. *   **FBI Involvement:** The FBI will transport physical evidence to 500 Pearl Street and provide electronic media for review, but only one laptop is available for the highly confidential images. The FBI will also segregate highly confidential evidence items. *   **Bronx Warehouse Inspection:** The defense team requests access to the FBI’s Bronx warehouse to photograph excluded items, with requirements for photographic documentation. *   **Equipment Needs:** The defense requires equipment (VCR, etc.) to play recordings, and requests permission to bring devices into the courthouse. *   **Confidentiality Protocol:** Strict adherence to the Protective Order is emphasized, including restrictions on photographing certain items. *   **Communication & Scheduling:** The parties are coordinating a call to discuss the plan and finalize the schedule. The initial call is set for March 10th at 1:30 PM ET/ 11:30 AM MST.

Maxwell* (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)). Key elements include: *   **Scheduling:** A meeting at 11:00 AM on April 12th at the Bronx warehouse is initially proposed, with the possibility of further trips to review additional evidence. The review ultimately moves to 500 Pearl Street, beginning April 13th. *   **Evidence Location:** The evidence is primarily located in the FBI’s Bronx warehouse and, subsequently, at 500 Pearl Street. *   **Exhibit Access:** The defense team (Christian Everdell, Laura Menninger, Jeff Pagliuca, and Bobbi C. Sternheim) will be granted access to photographs and potentially electronic media (CDs, laptops) for review. *   **Confidentiality:**  Emphasis is placed on the highly confidential nature of some evidence, particularly nude images, and the need to handle those items with caution. *   **Logistics & Support:** The FBI will provide support with equipment (e.g., VCRs, CD players), transport, and an agent to accompany the defense team.  The AUSA will be present at the warehouse. *   **Discrepancies & Clarifications:**  Laura Menninger raises several questions and concerns regarding the available evidence, including discrepancies in item locations, the need to photograph certain items, and the segregation of “highly confidential” materials.  The AUSA addresses these concerns and clarifies the approach to evidence review.

This document outlines the logistics for the defense team (Laura Menninger, Christian Everdell, Jeff Pagliuca, and Bobbi Sternheim) to review evidence in the US v. Maxwell case, overseen by an Assistant United States Attorney. The review will primarily take place at the Bronx warehouse (2350 Lafayette Ave, Bronx, NY) and potentially at 500 Pearl Street. Here's a breakdown of the key points: *   **Initial Meeting & Scheduling:** The AUSA proposed a meeting at the warehouse at 11 am on April 12th, and the defense team confirmed this. *   **Evidence Access:** The FBI will make evidence available for review at the warehouse, and the defense team will have access to photograph and inspect the evidence. Certain items (“highly confidential”) will be restricted from photography. *   **Item Exclusions:** The defense intends to exclude certain items – massage tables, cash, and bulky/fragile items – from being transported to 500 Pearl Street. *   **Electronic Media:** The FBI will provide electronic media (DVDs, digital files) for review, but access to the equipment to play these files will need to be arranged. The defense will investigate and potentially bring their own. *   **Maxwell’s Presence:** Ms. Maxwell will be produced to 500 Pearl Street daily, starting April 13th, for the review. *   **Logistics and Coordination:** The AUSA will facilitate the process, coordinate with the FBI, and handle any questions or issues that arise. The document is a series of emails and attachments, primarily between the AUSA and Laura Menninger, detailing the arrangement of the evidence review process.

Attorney’s Office (Southern District of New York) and Bobbi Sternheim, attorney for Maxwell, regarding the review of evidence in the *U.S. v. Maxwell* (20 Cr. 330) case. Key individuals involved include Laura Menninger (Haddon, Morgan & Foreman) and Jeff Pagliuca (HMFLaw). *   **Evidence Logistics:** The core of the emails focuses on the arrangement of evidence review. The government proposes the use of the 500 Pearl Street location, with a proposed review schedule starting April 13th, running daily until completion. *   **Physical Evidence Access:** The U.S. Attorney's Office agreed to allow Sternheim’s team to inspect and photograph certain physical evidence at the Bronx warehouse, excluding specific items (cash, some electronics) based on their size or potential confidentiality. *   **Electronic Evidence Review:** The government intends to provide the defense with electronic evidence (images and recordings) for review at 500 Pearl Street, although access to the data may require specific equipment. There are proposed safeguards in place regarding the handling of highly confidential electronic images. *   **Maxwell’s Appearance:** The government confirms Maxwell will be produced to 500 Pearl Street on April 13th and every day thereafter. *   **Protective Order & Confidentiality:** Throughout the correspondence, the importance of the Protective Order and maintaining confidentiality is repeatedly emphasized.  A detailed spreadsheet outlines the designated “Confidential” and “Highly Confidential” items. *   **Ongoing Coordination:** The letters establish an ongoing communication and logistical coordination process between the prosecution and defense teams.

Maxwell* (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)). *   **Evidence Viewing Plan:** The U.S. Attorney proposes a plan for reviewing the evidence, including a scheduled review at 500 Pearl Street starting April 13th, with the possibility of rotating days. The review would initially start at 8:30 AM and last until 4:30 PM each day. *   **Personnel Involved:** The communication involves a team including Laura Menninger, Christian Everdell (Cohen & Gresser LLP), Jeff Pagliuca (Cohen & Gresser LLP), Bobbi Sternheim, Jim Harkins, and Simek Shropshire.  The FBI and Marshals are also key players. *   **Specific Evidence Arrangements:** The U.S. Attorney is arranging for the FBI to transport the evidence to 500 Pearl Street.  They will provide a laptop for review of “highly confidential” electronic images. The FBI plans to bring Maxwell to 500 Pearl Street on April 13th. *   **Item Restrictions:**  Certain items (those designated "highly confidential") will not be photographed, unless authorized.  The FBI will not make duplicates of those items.  The shredded paper is currently being analyzed by the FBI lab. *   **Discovery Issues:**  Laura Menninger raises concerns about discrepancies in the inventory of evidence, specifically regarding the "highly confidential" electronic images that had not been previously provided.  The U.S. Attorney addresses this by explaining the process of obtaining and providing those images. *   **Logistical Details:** The communication addresses logistical considerations like space at 500 Pearl Street, the use of electronic devices, and arrangements for Ms. Maxwell's presence.

On April 13, 2021, Christian Everdell, acting on behalf of defense counsel, requested Judge Nathan’s authorization to allow the introduction of electronic devices into the courthouse for evidence viewing. Jeff Pagliuca, counsel, had previously sent a request to Judge Nathan for permission to bring electronic devices and equipment into the courthouse. An order signed by Judge Nathan was attached to the initial email.

Bobbi Sternheim sent an email dated April 14, 2021, regarding the U.S. v. Maxwell S2 case (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)). The email included a request, a proposed order for Marshall, and supporting documents: a letter, a HTML document, and another proposed order. The email was sent to Nathan Chambers, Christian Everdell, Laura Menninger, and Jeff Pagliuca.

This email, dated April 16, 2021, is from a Law Clerk to Judge Alison J. Nathan regarding case 20-cr-330, US v Maxwell. The attached document is an order that will be entered into the public docket. Counsel including Nathan NYSD Chambers, CEverdell®CohenGresser.com, Jeff Pagliuca, Laura Menninger, meohen@cohengressercom, bc_stemheimlaw.com are recipients of the email.

Jeff Pagliuca sent a collection of documents, including responses to a motion to quash, subpoenas, and a letter regarding redactions, to Laura Mennin, Nicole Simmons, and Sabina Mariella. Sigrid McCawley requested confirmation that these materials could be sent to the Government for review and potential redaction requests, following Judge Nathan’s order.

The email correspondence concerns the US v. Maxwell case (20 Cr. 330 (MN)). It includes a government letter response to a defense motion for a trial adjournment and a supplemental letter requesting the filing of the response under seal due to the presence of private medical information. The email is from the Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York to Christian Everdell, Laura Menninger, Jeff Pagliuca, and Cohen. Attached documents include the government letter and a request to file under seal.

Bobbi Sternheim sent an email with a courtesy copy of an ECF filing regarding the case U.S. v. Maxwell S2 20 Cr. 330 (AJN) to [REDACTED], Christian Everdell, Laura Mennin er, and Jeff Pagliuca. The attachment was a letter titled “Letter_to_Court_re-_42421.pdf”.

On April 28, 2021, Laura Menninger (Haddon, Morgan & Foreman, P.C.) and Bobbi Sternheim contacted Jeff Pagliuca and Mark S. Cohen regarding the US v. Maxwell case (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)). Menninger proposed sending a position on defense disclosures by email and offered a call for discussion, aiming for a joint filing on Monday. She also requested input on a proposed schedule for witness statement disclosures, referencing Judge Nathan’s Order 250. Furthermore, they planned to submit a letter to Judge Nathan requesting exclusion of Speedy Trial Act time related to the S2 Indictment, pending the suppression motion and trial date, and sought consent from the defense counsel to this exclusion.

Bobbi sent a courtesy copy of an Electronic Correspondence Filing (ECF) regarding the case U.S. v. Maxwell S2 20 Cr. 330 (AJN) to [REDACTED] and [REDACTED]. The ECF filing, titled "Letter_re-fileep_Deprivation-4-29-21.pdf," is attached. Christian Everdell, Laura Mennin er, and Jeff Pagliuca are included in the "Cc:" field.

Bobbi Sternheim sent an email attachment, a courtesy copy of the ECF filing in the case of U.S. v. Maxwell, Case Number S2 20 Cr. 330 (AJN), to Christian Everdell, Jeff Pagliuca, and Laura Mennin. The attachment is named Reply_to_Dkt_270.pdf and ATT00001.htm.

Bobbi Sternheim sent a letter, attached as “Letter_ret Trial_Start_Date.pdf”, requesting a trial start date of November 8th for the case “US v. Maxwell” to Christian Everdell and Jeff Pagliuca. The letter is a courtesy copy.

Laura Menninger of Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C. is contacting counsel regarding a potential violation of Local Criminal Rule 23.1. She cites a Sun article mentioning statements made by David Markus (representing Ghislaine Maxwell) as potentially problematic, given the rule’s broad application to lawyers associated with witnesses. She requests confirmation that Spencer Kuvin does not represent any witnesses and asks for a response by Monday. The communication includes a chain of emails between legal representatives, including Jeff Pagliuca and Bobbi Sternheim, and concerns a case involving Ghislaine Maxwell.

An email exchange regarding a Rule 17 submission in the case *US v. Maxwell* (20 Cr. 330, MN). The Assistant United States Attorney (Nathan NYSD Chambers) notes that counsel (Bobbi Sternheim, Jeff Pagliuca, Laura Menninger) claims multiple attempts to confer with the government regarding photographs, but the team has no record of these attempts between May 6th and May 12th, 2021. Laura Menninger responds with a letter response to the government’s submission, including Exhibits A and B, one of which was marked “Confidential” and filed under seal pending a court order.

A United States Attorney’s Office update letter regarding MDC conditions in the case of *US v. Maxwell* is due to the Court on June 7, 2021. The attorney is requesting confirmation by 8:30 pm if the recipient intends to request redactions to the attached letter and will provide an opportunity to propose and justify any redactions.

Bobbi Sternheim sent a courtesy copy of ECF filing related to U.S. v. Maxwell S2 20 Cr. 330 (MN) to several recipients, including Christian Everdell, Laura Menninger, and Jeff Pagliuca. The filing is attached as Reply_to_Order_Dkt_312.pdf and ATT00001.htm.

Bobbi Sternheim sent an email with a courtesy copy of an Electronic Case File (ECF) filing related to the U.S. v. Maxwell S2 case (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)). The ECF filing, attached as Letter_re_VICs_8-18-18.pdf and ATT00001.htm, was sent to recipients including Christian Everdell, Laura Menninger, and Jeff Pagliuca.

A letter from the Assistant United States Attorney, Jeff Pagliuca, of the United States Attorney's Office, Southern District of New York (EFTA00029589), is circulating regarding GM Defense’s response to concerns about co-conspirator identities and statements. The letter was dated August 30, 2021.

This email, dated September 15, 2021, from the Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, is sent to Christian Everdell, Mark S. Cohen, Bobbi Stemheim, Laura Menninger, and Jeff Pagliuca. It includes attachments related to the case *US v. Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330 (AJN)* and a letter regarding Flatley, and a PDF document labeled 3503-00I.

A letter from the Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York to Christian Everdell, Bobbi C. Sternheim, Jeff Pagliuca, and Laura Menninger regarding a notice related to case EFTA00011132 is attached. The letter is dated October 13, 2021, and includes a PDF attachment titled “2021.10.13_GM_12.2_letter to_defense.pdf”.

On October 14, 2021, Bobbi Sternheim’s Law Offices filed a courtesy copy of an ECF filing related to U.S. v. Maxwell S2 (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)) to multiple recipients including [REDACTED], Christian Everdell, Laura Menninger, and Jeff Pagliuca. The filing was sent from [REDACTED] to fla(USANYS) (USANYS).

A communication chain regarding the case *U.S. v. Maxwell S2 20 Cr. 330 (AJN)* is being coordinated. Judge Nathan requested a response to a letter from Bobbi Sternheim by 5 pm on October 15, 2021. Efforts were made to contact the Bureau of Prisons (BOP) to schedule a call. Sternheim filed a courtesy copy of the ECF filing that evening, involving multiple legal counsel including Christian Everdell, Laura Menninger, Jeff Pagliuca, and the sender's organization, Law Offices of Bobbi C. Sternheim.

The attached documents, including a Government’s reply brief and proposed redactions, relate to the case *US v. Maxwell* (20 CR 330 (AJN)). The Government is responding to motions in limine issued by the Court. A redacted version of the brief is to be filed on the public docket on October 29, 2021.

Bobbi C. Sternheim sent an email on November 3, 2021, to multiple recipients including Christian Everdel, Laura Menninger, and Jeff Pagliuca. The email contained a courtesy copy of an Electronic Case File (ECF) filing related to “U.S. v. Maxwell S2 20 Cr. 330 (MN)” and a PDF document titled “Disclosure of Juror Names to Counsel Only upon completion of Questionnaire.” Sternheim also reiterated her new office address and preferred email address within the email.

*   The goal is to compile data for a joint submission to the court outlining juror categories (joint keeps, joint strikes, government-only strikes, and defense-only strikes). *   A draft joint letter is being circulated for review and edits. *   The defense team requests the Assistant United States Attorney to send their strike list in Excel format. *   The Assistant United States Attorney requests a simultaneous exchange of strike lists by noon on November 7, 2021, to facilitate the data compilation process. *   Three juror numbers (127, 151, and 458) have been withdrawn from objection and joined in support of proceeding to voir dire.

This email discusses the production of discovery materials related to the case *US v. Maxwell* (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)). The Assistant United States Attorney is sending an additional discovery production to Mark S. Cohen, Bobbi Sternheim, Laura Menninger, and Jeff Pagliuca via USAfx. The production will be sent to the MDC for Ms. Maxwell. Options for delivery include a CD or a provided drive, with the possibility of returning a drive to load the production. The email includes contact information for the United States Attorney’s Office, Southern District of New York.

Nicole Simmons of Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C., sent correspondence to multiple counsel regarding the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)). The attached document, dated November 8, 2021, is a letter related to Rule 801(d)(2) redactions.  Jeff Pagliuca, Laura Menninger, CeVerdell, and Brian Stemheim are listed as recipients.

Sternheim, is involved in the trial preparation for the case of *United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell*.  The primary dispute centers around the trial start date, with the defense (Sternheim’s office) strongly advocating for November 8, 2021, due to concerns about continuity of counsel, potential witness unavailability, and the disruptive impact of a later trial on Maxwell’s health and holiday plans.  The prosecution (represented by Laura Menninger and Jeff Pagliuca) initially proposed November 29, 2021, but later suggested November 15th as a compromise.  The defense emphasized the need for a speedy trial and raised concerns about the government’s failure to provide specifics justifying the preferred date.  Scheduling conflicts related to Laura Menninger’s other trial and the need to review 3500 material were also discussed, with the defense linking these to the request for a speedy trial.  A key point of contention is the potential exclusion of Speedy Trial Act time, which the defense opposes unless Ms. Maxwell is released on bail. Communication primarily occurred through email, with a focus on establishing a trial date by the end of the year.

Bobbi Sternheim sent emails to multiple recipients, including Christian Everdell, Laura Niel, Jeff Pagliuca, and the USANYS, regarding proposed jury questionnaires and voir dire questions. Attached documents included: JOINT_Proposed_Jury_Questionnaire_.docx, ATT00001.htm, JOINT_Proposed_Voir Dire_Sent_.docx, and ATT00002.htm.

On November 13, 2021, Laura Menninger sent emails to Ann Lundberg and Jeff Pagliuca regarding prospective juror questionnaires. Menninger provided a list of objections to jurors 626, 629, 632, 640, 643, 646, 649, 657, 681, 682, 647, and 655. She also attached an Excel file of the completed questionnaires for easier import.  The Assistant United States Attorney sent an email on November 12, 2021, informing the recipients that completed questionnaires were available on USAfx and requesting a list of objections by 1 p.m. the following day to facilitate the creation of a joint letter to the court.

Nathan NYSD Chambers sent an email to Laura Menninger and Jeff Pagliuca regarding a memo endorsement issued by Judge Alison J. Nathan in the case 20cr330, U.S. v. Maxwell. The memo concerns the defense’s motion on FRE 412 and was attached as a PDF named “20cr330 ME 10.15.2 1 .pdf”. Chambers intends to file the memo on the public docket on Monday morning and requests confirmation of receipt.

On November 15, 2021, the Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York sent a letter to multiple parties, including Nathan NYSD Chambers, Laura Menninger, Jeff Pagliuca, and ceverdell@cohengresser.com, regarding the United States v. Maxwell case (20 Cr. 330). The letter attached a joint letter containing a list of names and places intended for voir dire purposes.

Bobbi Sternheini sent an external email regarding the case *U.S. v. Maxwell S2* (20 Cr. 330 (MN)). The email included a courtesy copy of an ECF filing (Defense_Reply_to_Dkt_350.pdf; ATT00001.htm) and was sent to Christian Everdell, Laura Mennin, and Jeff Pagliuca.

On November 16, 2021, the Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York sent additional discovery materials related to *U.S. v. Maxwell* (20 Cr. 330 (MN)) to Christian Everdell, Laura Menninger, Jeff Pagliuca, and the USANYS contractor. The materials included cover letters, indices for testifying and non-testifying witness material, and exhibit indices. The production will be delivered via USAfx, and one hard drive provided by the recipient will be sent to the MDC for Ms. Maxwell.

Bobbi Sternhei sent an external email regarding the U.S. v. Maxwell S2 case (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)). The email attached a courtesy copy of an ECF filing titled "Response_to_Govt_voir dire_opposition.pdf" and an HTML document (ATT00001.htm). Christian Everdell, Laura Mennin, and Jeff Pagliuca were included in the “To” field.

An email chain discusses Ms. Maxwell’s 13 motions in limine filed in the U.S. v. Maxwell case (20 Cr. 330). Nicole Simmons attached the motions and supporting cover letters from the Wisa.doj.gov cloud share drive, responding to a request for access and distribution from Nathan NYSD Chambers and Jeff Pagliuca.

The Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York sent motions in limine regarding the case *US v. Maxwell*, case number 20 Cr. 330 (AJN), to Laura Menninger, Jeff Pagliuca, and others. The motions request temporary acceptance under seal, along with attached documents including redacted versions of government filings related to the case.

A draft joint proposed request to charge was sent from the Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York to Christian Everde, Bobbi C Sternheim, Jeff Pagliuca, and Laura Menninger. The request is related to a defense counsel document (Maxwell_RTCJ2021.10.212o_defense_counsel].docx) and requires comments, including proposed jury instructions, to be sent as a redline to the document by Sunday, October 24th, due to a court deadline of Wednesday, October 27th.

Bobbi Sternheim sent an external email to Christian Everdell, Laura Menninger, and Jeff Pagliuca regarding the filing “10-27 It to Court.pdf” in the case US v. Maxwell S2 20 Cr 330 (MN). The email included a courtesy copy of the ECF filing.

Bobbi C. Sternheim sent an email to multiple recipients, including Christian Everdell, Laura Menninger, and Jeff Pagliuca, providing a courtesy copy of an Electronic Case File (ECF) filing related to the case *US v. Maxwell 52 20 Cr 330 (AJN)*. The email includes her updated contact information and a standard confidentiality disclaimer.

Nicole Simmons of Haddon, Morgan & Foreman P.C. sent an email to Nathan NYSD Chambers and Jeff Pagliuca regarding the case *U.S. v. Maxwell, Case No. 20 Cr. 330 (AJN)*. The email contained Ms. Maxwell's reply brief in support of her motions in limine, along with the government’s reply brief (unredacted), and an image.

The Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York is sending additional discovery related to the US v. Maxwell case (20 Cr. 330 (MN)) to Christian Everdel, Laura Menning, Jeff Pagliuca, and Ms. Maxwell. This discovery, including exhibits, will be provided via USAfx. The attorney is offering to send a CD to the MDC for Ms. Maxwell or to provide a drive if requested.

The document pertains to redactions submitted in response to a government motion in limine regarding evidence in a case (EFTA00025062). The defense team (represented by Christian Everdell, Laura Menninger, and Jeff Pagliuca) has provided redacted versions of their motions, exhibits, and the government’s omnibus opposition and reply. Specifically, the following exhibits are proposed for sealing: Exhibits A through D, G, and H from the defendant’s motions, and Exhibits E and G from the government’s exhibits. The defense objects to the government’s proposed redactions and requests the submission of additional redacted materials. The core purpose is to manage the presentation of potentially sensitive information during the legal proceedings.

The email outlines the redaction of several documents related to a government motion in limine, a defendant’s opposition, and the government’s reply in a legal case. Redacted versions of these documents, along with a redacted version of Government Exhibit A, are being sent to Christian Everdell, Bobbi C Sternheim, Laura Menninger, and Jeff Pagliuca. Only defense exhibits E and G can be filed publicly; all other defense exhibits should be filed under seal.

An order (20cr330_Order 11.1.21.pdf) issued by Judge Nathan regarding the case US v. Maxwell has been sent to Jeff Pagliuca, Laura Mennin, bcsternheim, CEverdell, and Nathan NYSD Chambers for confirmation of receipt.

The United States Attorney’s Office, Southern District of New York, is sending supplemental testifying and non-testifying witness material related to the case *US v. Maxwell* (20 Cr. 330 (MN)) to Christian Everdell, Bobbi C Sternheim, Laura Menninger, and Jeff Pagliuca. The material, including a cover letter and indices, is being sent via USAfx and will be loaded onto a hard drive for delivery to the MDC for Ghislaine Maxwell.

Christian Everdell is following up with Jeff Pagliuca and Laura Menninger regarding the handling of victim notifications and reporting to the court in the case of *US v. Maxwell* (20cr330). An order was filed by the Hon. Alison J. Nathan requiring a response, but the court has not yet received one from the parties.

Christian Everdell of Cohen & Gresser LLP sent an external email to [REDACTED], Jeff Pagliuca, and Laura Menninger regarding a Defense Rule 16 disclosure. The email included attachments related to the disclosure, specifically redacted documents including: a letter to the government, certifications from AT&T and FedEx, a list of certified FedEx invoices, Interlochen Records, a redacted A. Farmer Release, and an Epstein NPA. A confidentiality notice and privacy policy link were also included.

A communication between Jeff Pagliuca and Laura Menninger, along with chambers of Judge Alison J. Nathan, discusses a sealed memorandum opinion and order (20cr330_SEALED_Mem._Op_&_Order_11.11.21.pdf) regarding the case US v. Maxwell. The order relates to a new case mentioned during an argument and the court’s understanding of concessions made by the defense. The document was to be docketed the following morning.

Nicole Simmons, on behalf of Haddon, Morgan and Foreman P.C., submitted Ms. Maxwell’s response to the Government’s Motion In Limine to Preclude Expert Testimony of Dr. Park Dietz and Dr. Elizabeth Loftus in the case of U.S. v. Maxwell, Case No. 20 Cr. 330 (AJN). The response, along with supporting documents (Ex._1.pdf and Ex._2.pdf), was initially submitted under temporary seal to allow the government to propose redactions. The email chain originates from Nathan NYSD Chambers and includes Jeff Pagliuca and Laura Mennin.

A letter motion was sent from the Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York to Nathan NYSD Chambers, along with several recipients including BC Sternheim, Ceverdell®Cohengresser.com, Laura Menninger tenninger@hmflaw.com, and Jeff Pagliuca, regarding the US v. Maxwell case (20 Cr. 330 (MN)). The motion requests determination that Minor Victims' Birth certificates are self-authenticating, provided in both an unredacted and proposed redacted form. Attached documents include a motion and a proposed redaction version.

An email was sent from the Chambers of the Hon. Alison J. Nathan to Jeff Pagliuca and Laura Menninger regarding a Memorandum Opinion & Order (Dkt. No. 477) in the case of US v. Maxwell (20cr330). The email attached a sealed opinion on MV-3 and requested confirmation of receipt.

A communication regarding the discovery production in the case of *US v. Maxwell* (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)). A corrected cover letter was sent to Laura Mennin, detailing a correction of an SDNY file number error (changing SDNY_GM_02774195 to SDNY_GM_02774105). Hard drives containing discovery materials were shipped to Mennin’s office in Colorado and to Maxwell’s client at the MDC via FedEx. Some Bates numbers (2774105-2774194) were missing from the production and were requested for clarification. An additional discovery production including witness material and exhibits was also being prepared for shipment via hard drive and USAfx.

Christian Everdell sent a revised stipulation, labeled “Defendant’s Trial Exhibit A,” to Bobbi C. Sternheim, Esq., Laura Menninger, and Jeff Pagliuca. The revision included specifying the document as a “true and accurate copy of the transcript of one witness's trial testimony, but not the full trial transcript, given on February 26.” Sternheim, an Assistant United States Attorney, responded agreeing to the revised language and indicating they were fine with alternative wording.

The Government of the United States, via the Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, submitted a reply brief regarding Government Exhibit 52 (“GX 52”) to a case titled *US v. Maxwell*. The brief was attached to an email sent to multiple recipients, including Nathan Chambers, Christian Everdell, Jeff Pagliuca, and Laura Menninger, and was initially submitted temporarily under seal.

A letter motion to file a reply brief was sent from the Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York to Nathan NYSD Chambers, Christian Everdell, Jeff Pagliuca, and Laura Menninger regarding the case *US v. Maxwell*. The motion supports the Government's motion to preclude Dr. Ryan Hall’s testimony. The attached documents, including a letter motion, proposed reply brief, and exhibit, were submitted temporarily under seal.

Nathan NYSD Chambers sent an order from Judge Alison J. Nathan regarding the case *US v. Maxwell* (20 Cr. 330) to Laura Menninger and Jeff Pagliuca. Jeff Pagliuca had previously submitted a letter motion to preclude cross-examination, which was filed under seal by the Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York. Chambers requested confirmation of receipt of the order.

Nathan NYSD Chambers is sending an order (Order 10.31.21.pdf) regarding the case US v. Maxwell (20cr330) to Jeff Pagliuca and Laura Mennirper. The order was issued by Judge Alison J. Nathan and will be docketed the following morning. Chambers requests confirmation of receipt.
